p: Huang et al. (2019) conducted a cross-sectional epidemiological study on a sample of 32552 Chinese people and reported 12 month prevalence and lifetime prevalence of mental health problems. In this study, the 12 month prevalence of anxiety was 5%, 3.6 % for depression, 1.8 % for alcohol use disorder and life prevalence of anxiety was 6.8 %, 7.6 % for depression, and 4.4 % for alcohol use disorder ( Huang et al., 2019). This statistic represents the mental health condition of Chinese people in a normal period. However, there are no available statistics about psychological health mainly the prevalence of psychological problems among people during an epidemic outbreak.
